tit.e: Gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate) in Kyoto
tit.cmt: 用語集には「Gokenin (an immediate vasal of the shogunate) around Kyoto」と登録されていますが、「vasal」は、正しくは「vassal」であり、また、同義語の「在京人」を「Kamakura Bakufu vassals stationed in Kyoto」としているサイト(http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110002369271/en)があることから、本文では左記のように訳しております。
tit.e: Gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate) in Kyoto
Gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate) in Kyoto

sen.j: 在京御家人（ざいきょうごけにん）とは、鎌倉幕府傘下の京都及びその周辺部に常駐する御家人のこと。
sen.e: The term "gokenin in Kyoto" (zaikyo gokenin) refers to a gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) who was permanently stationed in and around Kyoto under jurisdiction of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

The term "gokenin in Kyoto" (zaikyo gokenin) refers to a gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) who was permanently stationed in and around Kyoto under jurisdiction of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

The term "gokenin in Kyoto" (zaikyo gokenin) refers to a gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) who was permanently stationed in and around Kyoto under jurisdiction of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 在京人とも呼ばれている。
sen.e: A gokenin in Kyoto is also referred to as zaikyonin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 在京人: 用語集には「an immediate vasal of the shogunate around Kyoto」と登録されていますが(* 正しくは「vassal」)、ここでは日本語で別の呼称があることを示すことが目的ですので、まずローマ字読みを表記し、その後のカッコ内に、本文の「在京御家人」の訳語に合わせた説明を記載しています。
sen.e: A gokenin in Kyoto is also referred to as zaikyonin.
sen.cmt: 在京人は在京御家人の別名であり、在京御家人の説明は既にあるのでカッコ部分は削除しました。
sen.e: A gokenin in Kyoto is also referred to as zaikyonin.

sen.j: ただし、短期間での交替勤務である京都大番役は除外される場合が多い。
sen.e: They were often released from Kyoto obanyaku (a job to guard Kyoto) because the job was a shift work only for a short period of time.
However, they were often excluded from Kyoto obanyaku (a job to guard Kyoto) because the job was a shift work only for a short period of time.
sen.cmt: However を挿入し、released→excluded と修正しました。
sen.e: However, they were often excluded from Kyoto obanyaku (a job to guard Kyoto) because the job was a shift work only for a short period of time.

sen.j: 初期の在京御家人は西国に所領を持つ御家人が主であった。
sen.e: A gokenin in Kyoto in the early days referred mainly to one who owned a shoryo (territory) in Saigoku (western part of Japan (especially Kyushu, but ranging as far east as Kinki)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A gokenin in Kyoto in the early days referred mainly to the ones who owned a shoryo (territory) in Saigoku (western part of Japan ([especially Kyushu, but ranging as far east as Kinki]).
sen.cmt: one→the ones と修正しました。 カッコを修正しました。
sen.e: A gokenin in Kyoto in the early days referred mainly to the ones who owned a shoryo (territory) in Saigoku (western part of Japan ([especially Kyushu, but ranging as far east as Kinki]).

sen.j: だが、東国から派遣された御家人も存在していた。
sen.e: But there were also gokenin sent from Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But there were also gokenin sent from Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region).
But there were also gokenin sent from Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region).

sen.j: 彼らは原則的には鎌倉幕府の指揮下で行動した。
sen.e: They acted under the command of the Kamakura bakufu in principle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They served under the command of the Kamakura bakufu in principle.
They served under the command of the Kamakura bakufu in principle.

sen.j: だが、当時の幕府の持つ検断権は朝廷の承認に基づくものであった。
sen.e: However, the right to judge criminal cases owned by the bakufu at that time was based on approval given by the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the right to judge criminal cases used by the bakufu at that time was based on the approval given by the Imperial Court.
However, the right to judge criminal cases used by the bakufu at that time was based on the approval given by the Imperial Court.

sen.j: だから、幕府より上位に位置する朝廷からの命令を拒否できなかった。
sen.e: Therefore, they could not refuse a command given by the Imperial Court which was superior to the bakufu in rank.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, they could not refuse any command given by the Imperial Court which was superior to the bakufu in rank.
Therefore, they could not refuse any command given by the Imperial Court which was superior to the bakufu in rank.

sen.j: (そのため)、その命令に基づいて警固などの活動も行った。
sen.e: For that reason, they also worked as a guard, etc. by a command of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文頭のカッコ内に「そのため」を補いました) /
sen.e: (For that reason), they also worked as guards, etc. by the commands of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: カッコを挿入しました。a guard→guards,a command→the commands と修正しました。
sen.e: (For that reason), they also worked as guards, etc. by the commands of the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 後鳥羽院はその事情を利用して在京御家人を検非違使や衛府の官人に任命した。
sen.e: The Retired Emperor Gotoba took advantage of these circumstances to appoint gokenin in Kyoto to kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) or government official (especially one of low to medium rank) for efu (a palace guard).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Retired Emperor Gotoba took advantage of these circumstances to appoint gokenin in Kyoto to kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) or government official (especially one of low to medium rank) to be efu (a palace guard).
sen.cmt: for→to be と修正しました。
sen.e: The Retired Emperor Gotoba took advantage of these circumstances to appoint gokenin in Kyoto to kebiishi (officials with judicial and police powers) or government official (especially one of low to medium rank) to be efu (a palace guard).

sen.j: 独自に所領を与えたり、北面の武士・西面の武士に加えることが多かった。
sen.e: He often gave a shoryo to them or added them to Hokumen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the north side) or Saimen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the west side) in his own right.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He often gave shoryo to them or added them in the Hokumen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the north side) or the Saimen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the west side) in his own right.
sen.cmt: a を削除しました。to→in と修正しました。
sen.e: He often gave shoryo to them or added them in the Hokumen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the north side) or the Saimen no bushi (the Imperial Palace Guards for the west side) in his own right.

sen.j: それは、鎌倉幕府において京都の代表を務める京都守護にも言える事であった。
sen.e: The same was true of kyoto-shugo (military governor of Kyoto) who was the representative of the Kamakura bakufu in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 / 鎌倉幕府において京都の代表を務める: 京都守護が鎌倉にいたのか、京都にいたのか判断しづらい表現ですが、実際には京都にいたため(「http://kotobank.jp/word/%E4%BA%AC%E9%83%BD%E5%AE%88%E8%AD%B7」の「デジタル大辞泉」)、その意味で訳しています。
sen.e: The same was true of kyoto-shugo (military governor of Kyoto) who was the representative of the Kamakura bakufu in Kyoto.
The same was true of kyoto-shugo (military governor of Kyoto) who was the representative of the Kamakura bakufu in Kyoto.

sen.j: (京都守護は)一時期を除いて親幕派公家から選ばれている。
sen.e: The kyoto-shugo was selected among pro-bakufu court nobles except for a certain period of time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(分割で不完全な文になったため、文頭のカッコ内に主語を補いました) / 親幕派: 「京都守護にも朝廷の影響が及んだ」という文脈から考えると、正しくは「親朝廷派」ではないかという疑問も生じますが、「(京都守護にも朝廷の影響が及んだため、その影響を少なくするために)親幕派公家から、京都守護が選ばれた」という意味が暗示されていると考えれば、この内容でつじつまが合います。いずれにせよ、指示書通り、原文通りに訳しています。
sen.e: The kyoto-shugo was chosen from among the pro-bakufu court nobles, except for a certain period of time.
sen.cmt: selected→chosen from と修正し、the, カンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: The kyoto-shugo was chosen from among the pro-bakufu court nobles, except for a certain period of time.

sen.j: 在京御家人は鎌倉（幕府）よりも目の前にある朝廷の影響を強く受けるようになった。
sen.e: The Imperial Court, which was close to gokenin in Kyoto, came to exert a stronger influence on them than the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The gokenin in Kyoto began to be strongly influenced by the Imperial Court which was before their eyes, rather than the Kamakura bakufu,
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: The gokenin in Kyoto began to be strongly influenced by the Imperial Court which was before their eyes, rather than the Kamakura bakufu,

sen.j: 承久の乱ではその多くが後鳥羽院側について没落した。
sen.e: Accordingly, many of them took sides with the Retired Emperor Gotoba in the Jokyu War to fall.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Accordingly, many of them took the side with the Retired Emperor Gotoba in the Jokyu War then lost their power.
sen.cmt: sides→the side,to fall→, then lost their power と修正しました。
sen.e: Accordingly, many of them took the side with the Retired Emperor Gotoba in the Jokyu War then lost their power.

sen.j: 乱後、六波羅探題が設置されてそのもとで在京御家人が再建される。
sen.e: As Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) was founded after the War, the system of gokenin in Kyoto was reconstructed under its control.
As Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) was founded after the war, the system of gokenin in Kyoto was reconstructed under its control.
As Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) was founded after the war, the system of gokenin in Kyoto was reconstructed under its control.

sen.j: 乱に際して幕府側に留まって地位・所領を保全された既存の在京御家人に加えて乱後に西国に所領を与えられて拠点を移した御家人が配属された。
sen.e: The bakufu assigned gokenin in Kyoto who remained loyal to it during the War to keep their position and shoryo, or those who moved to Saigoku after receiving a shoryo there after the War, to Rokuhara Tandai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 / 「御家人」を主語にすると、主語が長くなりすぎるため、「幕府」を主語にして、「御家人」の関係節は目的語にしております。
sen.e: The bakufu assigned gokenin in Kyoto who remained loyal to it during the war to keep their position and shoryo, and those who moved to Saigoku after given shoryo there after the war, to Rokuhara Tandai.
sen.cmt: War→war,or→and,receiving a shoryo→given shoryo と修正しました。
sen.e: The bakufu assigned gokenin in Kyoto who remained loyal to it during the war to keep their position and shoryo, and those who moved to Saigoku after given shoryo there after the war, to Rokuhara Tandai.

sen.j: 探題の指揮下で軍事・治安活動を行うようになる。
sen.e: They came to be engaged in military and security activities under the command of Rokuhara Tandai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They came to be engaged in military and security activities under the command of Rokuhara Tandai.
They came to be engaged in military and security activities under the command of Rokuhara Tandai.

sen.j: 彼らは京都に常駐する代わりに大番役などを免除された。
sen.e: They were released from duties such as Obanyaku (a job to guard Kyoto) in exchange for being permanently stationed in Kyoto.
They were exempted from duties such as Obanyaku (a job to guard Kyoto) in exchange for being permanently stationed in Kyoto.
They were exempted from duties such as Obanyaku (a job to guard Kyoto) in exchange for being permanently stationed in Kyoto.

sen.j: 後に篝屋が京都に設置された。
sen.e: Later some Kagariya (a guardhouse for soldiers placed at street corners in Kyoto and Kamakura during the Kamakura period) were built in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later Kagariya (a guardhouse for soldiers placed at street corners in Kyoto and Kamakura during the Kamakura period) were built in Kyoto.
Later Kagariya (a guardhouse for soldiers placed at street corners in Kyoto and Kamakura during the Kamakura period) were built in Kyoto.

sen.j: 在京御家人は篝屋料所と呼ばれる所領を手当として与えられた代わりに篝屋守護として京都市中の警固にあたった。
sen.e: Gokenin in Kyoto took charge of maintaining the security of the city as a "kagariya" guard in exchange for receiving a shoryo called kagariya ryosho (a granted estate for "kagariya" guarding service) as a benefit.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Gokenin in Kyoto took charge of maintaining the security of the city as kagariya guards in exchange for receiving a shoryo called kagariya ryosho (a granted estate for kagariya guarding service) as a benefit.
sen.cmt: クォーツを削除しました。a kagariya guard→kagariya guards と修正しました。
sen.e: Gokenin in Kyoto took charge of maintaining the security of the city as kagariya guards in exchange for receiving a shoryo called kagariya ryosho (a granted estate for kagariya guarding service) as a benefit.

sen.j: このため、在京御家人は篝屋御家人とも称されるようになった。
sen.e: Therefore, they came to be also referred to as kagariya gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in Kyoto).
Therefore, they came to be also called kagariya gokenin.
sen.cmt: referred to as→called と修正しました。カッコを削除しました。（別称であり、これと同じ在京御家人の説明は既存であるため）
sen.e: Therefore, they came to be also called kagariya gokenin.

sen.j: だが、朝廷や延暦寺などの諸権門との対立や元寇以後には畿内・西国で活発化した悪党との戦いに駆り出される事も多かった。
sen.e: But after conflicts with some powers such as the Imperial Court, Enryaku-ji Temple, etc., or after the Mongol invasion attempts against Japan, they were often pulled into a battle against Akuto (a villain in the medieval times) who intensified activities in Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) and Saigoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But they were also often recruited for such occasions, including the conflicts against some powers such as the Imperial Court, Enryaku-ji Temple and so on, or battles against Akuto (a villain in the medieval times) who became active in Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) and Saigoku after the Mongol invasion attempts against Japan,
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて流れをスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: But they were also often recruited for such occasions, including the conflicts against some powers such as the Imperial Court, Enryaku-ji Temple and so on, or battles against Akuto (a villain in the medieval times) who became active in Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) and Saigoku after the Mongol invasion attempts against Japan,

sen.j: 在京御家人の負担は重くなる一方であった。
sen.e: The burden on gokenin in Kyoto became heavier and heavier.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The burden on the gokenin in Kyoto became heavier and heavier.
The burden on the gokenin in Kyoto became heavier and heavier.

sen.j: 更に六波羅探題に派遣された御内人が在京御家人の監督をするようになった。
sen.e: In addition, miuchibito (private vassals of the tokuso) sent to Rokuhara Tandai came to supervise gokenin in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, miuchibito (private vassals of the tokuso) sent to Rokuhara Tandai came to supervise the gokenin in Kyoto.
In addition, miuchibito (private vassals of the tokuso) sent to Rokuhara Tandai came to supervise the gokenin in Kyoto.

sen.j: これに反発する在京御家人との対立が深まった。
sen.e: Conflicts with gokenin offended by it became worse.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The confrontation with gokenin in Kyoto who offended it became worse.
sen.cmt: 流れをよりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: The confrontation with gokenin in Kyoto who offended it became worse.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府滅亡前夜、足利高氏による六波羅探題攻撃において、最終的に六波羅探題と運命をともにした武士のほとんどが北条氏一族及び御内人であった。
sen.e: Most samurai who eventually went down with Rokuhara Tandai in the assault on it by Takauji ASHIKAGA on the eve of the fall of the Kamakura bakufu were members of the Hojo clan and miuchibito.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 / 六波羅探題攻撃: 定訳不明
sen.e: Most of the samurai who eventually went down with Rokuhara Tandai, in the assault on it by Takauji ASHIKAGA on the eve of the fall of the Kamakura bakufu, were the members of the Hojo clan and miuchibito.
sen.cmt: of the, カンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: Most of the samurai who eventually went down with Rokuhara Tandai, in the assault on it by Takauji ASHIKAGA on the eve of the fall of the Kamakura bakufu, were the members of the Hojo clan and miuchibito.

sen.j: 在京御家人がほとんどいないのは、高氏の動向を見て足利氏に寝返ったり戦線を離脱した者が多かったことを物語っている。
sen.e: Only few gokenin in Kyoto were included among them because many gokenin switched to the Ashikaga side or withdrew from the front after judging the movement of Takauji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Only few gokenin in Kyoto were included among them because many gokenin switched to the Ashikaga side or withdrew from the front after judging the movement of Takauji.
Only few gokenin in Kyoto were included among them because many gokenin switched to the Ashikaga side or withdrew from the front after judging the movement of Takauji.

sen.j: 生き残った在京御家人は室町幕府のもとで奉公衆などに再編成されることになる。
sen.e: Gokenin who survived it were reorganized into hokoshu (a military post in Muromachi Shogunate), etc. under jurisdiction of the Muromachi bakufu.
Gokenin who survived it were reorganized into hokoshu (a military post in Muromachi Shogunate), etc. under the jurisdiction of the Muromachi bakufu.
Gokenin who survived it were reorganized into hokoshu (a military post in Muromachi Shogunate), etc. under the jurisdiction of the Muromachi bakufu.

sen.j: 初期の主な在京御家人
sen.e: Major gokenin in Kyoto in the early days:
Major gokenin in Kyoto in the early days:
Major gokenin in Kyoto in the early days:

sen.j: 伊賀光季
sen.e: Mitsusue IGA
Mitsusue IGA
Mitsusue IGA

sen.j: 大内惟義
sen.e: Koreyoshi OUCHI
Koreyoshi OUCHI
Koreyoshi OUCHI

sen.j: 大内惟信
sen.e: Korenobu OUCHI
Korenobu OUCHI
Korenobu OUCHI

sen.j: 平賀朝雅
sen.e: Tomomasa HIRAGA
Tomomasa HIRAGA
Tomomasa HIRAGA

sen.j: 大江親広
sen.e: OE no Chikahiro
OE no Chikahiro
OE no Chikahiro

sen.j: 源頼兼
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorikane
MINAMOTO no Yorikane
MINAMOTO no Yorikane

sen.j: 源頼茂
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yorimochi
MINAMOTO no Yorimochi
MINAMOTO no Yorimochi

sen.j: 中原親能
sen.e: NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi
sen.cmt: 中原親能: 用語集には2つの読み方が登録されていますが、「なかはらのちかよし」が正しいようです(http://kotobank.jp/word/%E4%B8%AD%E5%8E%9F%E8%A6%AA%E8%83%BD)。ただし、この読み方で登録されている用語の表記は指示書と異なりますが、本文では指示書通りに表記しています。
sen.e: NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi
NAKAHARA no Chikayoshi

sen.j: 中原季時
sen.e: NAKAHARA no Suetoki
NAKAHARA no Suetoki
NAKAHARA no Suetoki
